something that you must do as a formal or official part of an activity or process
the formalities necessary for a valid marriage
something you must do even though it has no practical importance or effects
Getting a gun license here seems to be just a formality.
careful attention to polite behaviour and language in formal situations
There is always some degree of formality when one speaks to a stranger.
The loan was arranged with little formality.
something formal or official that you have to do so that a process can be completed properly
Certain formalities have to be completed before the legal transfer can take effect.
something that has to be done for official reasons but will not have any real effect on something that has already been planned or agreed
It will only be a formality to renew the agreement on a long-term basis.
Although the sale still requires the approval of the Chinese government, such approval is a mere formality.
